--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, tom helm <junkmail@t...> wrote:
> Milt-
> 	You are so cute sometimes :-) In Chinese the character is 
> haru (Spring) but in this context is read Kasu, hi becomes ga and 
> hara becomes no (field). One reason, perhaps, David couldn't find any 
> info without the specific kanji.


thank you, -T and Gordon,
How do I know it's a name of the place instead of a " description ".
I did say.... " Chinese reading " of the kanji.
By the way, the picture text was taken from the Lundgren collection 
book.
Personally I still think the association to Takeda and Kenshin is a bit 
of a stretch......... but I am not going to agrue with Haynes.

-m
